Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2013 06:46AM teacher911 wrote: Hi Stormy, I had a bilateral mastectomy 5years ago.Â  Last fall, I found a chest wall recurrence in the same area as the original BC, right side.Â  They removed the tumor and scanned me afterward.Â  It was during that scan they found bone mets in the left 6th anterior rib.Â  I had 4 months of chemo followed by 36tx of radiation to right chest wall, 8 of them were boosts.Â  When I started the radiation to the chest wall they also did SBRT steriotatic radiation 5tx to the left rib area.Â  I had no symptoms in the rib.Â  My MO and RO said they are hoping to achieve NED.Â  I just finished in early June and will not be scanned until the end of August so I don't know if I am there, but it is certainly possible to have radiation to the asymptomatic bone met because I did.Â  Also, when I had questions about the areas in which I was receiving radiation my RO showed me my graph and the areas I was receivingÂ  radiation and how much.Â  Maybe you can ask your RO to show you your plan.
Posts.Title: Radiation with bone mets question. Stormynyte MarieK

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2013 05:34AM teacher911 wrote: My Onc orders both every month.Â  She told me that they were useful in checking to see if chemo is working and now to see that I'm staying on the right track with Tamoxifen.Â  I also have scans every 6 months but I have the blood work done when I go for my monthly Zometa infusion.Â  I hope your doctor can clear this question up for you.

Posts.Content: Aug 19, 2013 07:34AM teacher911 wrote: Hi Dita,Â  When I was dx last year I looked into the program at Shands.Â  The Vero is the new state of the art radiation machine they use.Â  After discussing it with my MO and RO they felt I could achieve the same results with an older still state of the art machine they have at the University Hospital I go to.Â  I have not had my scans since finishing treatment in mid June, bu I am hopeful that I was able to achieve NED with this radiation treatment.Â  Keep talking to your doctors and as many people as you can find.Â  All the little bits of information will help you make your decision.Â  Where are your bone mets located?

Posts.Content: teacher911 wrote: I am curious if there are any stage IV sisters who have experienced encapsulation of their implants from radiation when they were already stage IV ? Â  I went through radiation last year after my dx for two reasons; one, was a steriotactic radiation to get rid of a bone met , which thankfully it did, secondly because I had a chest wall recurrence after a bilateral mx my RO decided to do radiation on my right side where the original and recurrence happened.Â  I thought I had gotten through the last effects of the radiation but just recently my silicone implant has become encapsulated.Â  I had the reconstruction done back in 2008.Â Â  If anyone has experienced this would you share what if anything you did about it with me.Â  Dx 3/2008, DCIS, 1cm, Stage 0, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 9/2012, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 11/16/2012 AC + T (Taxol) Hormonal Therapy 3/15/2013 Femara (letrozole), Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Radiation Therapy 4/17/2013 3DCRT: Breast, Lymph nodes, Bone Targeted Therapy 11/26/2016 Ibrance (palbociclib) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2013 04:48PM teacher911 wrote: I was dx in 2008 with DCIS.Â  After two unsuccessful lumpectomies no clear margins I chose to have a bilateral masectomy.Â  There was no tamoxifin, justÂ  twice a year exams.Â  This past September, I found a tumor in in my chest again.Â  Then the mets to my bones was found in my ribs.Â  Currently, I am undergoing dose dense chemo, 4 rounds of AC and then 4 rounds of Taxol.Â  What is going to happen next they aren't sure.Â  Possibly a surgery to remove a rib, 6 weeks of radiation, or SBRT.Â  IÂ  don't really understand the steriotatic radiation yet.Â  I am so sorry that you find yourself here but I know that in the few months I have been here I have been learning so much and for that I am so thankful.Â  I hope you feel all the love and support, there are so many wonderful helpful women on this site.

Posts.Content: teacher911 wrote: Hello,Â  I am curious if anyone knows anybody that has had a rib removed to treat their bone mets???Â  I was dx DCIS in 2008, after a couple of unsuccessful lumpectomies I had a bilateral masectomy that year.Â  I followed up faithfully with dr's appts and everything seemed to be fine.Â  This September, I felt a lump close to my original sight.Â Â  It turned out to be a chest wall recurrence that they removed in October.Â  I was still feeling pretty lucky when upon exam they asked about pain.Â  I mentioned this one spot in my mid left rib area.Â  Everyone, myself included felt it was the implant rubbing on the chest but to be sure I had a PET scan, boneÂ  scanÂ  which showed hot spots in this mid left rib.Â  Still not quite believing it they did a bone biopsy.Â  Well it is BC that has metastasized.Â  I have since joining this group notice that many of the Bone Mets ladies have done radiation or take Tamoxifen or Arimidex, few it seems did chemo right away.Â  I started chemo in November 4rounds of AC followed by 4 of Taxol.Â  I was told it was dose dense, still not sure that I really understand that.Â  The AC was kinder than the Taxol for me but the TAxol has brought my tumor markers down a lot.Â  Almost normal range.Â  I thought the plan wa to follow up with radiation but now my onc has me meeting with a thoracic surgeon to see if I am a candidate to have this rib removed.Â  I am very unsure about this whole idea.Â  They would have to remove the implant, no big deal there for me but this rib is right in the center of my rib cage.Â  I can't find any info on removal of a rib to treat bone mets.Â  I am so afraid that this might be life altering, and not in a good way. I know my onc is hoping that it would get me to NED.Â  I meet with the thoracic surgeon this week and my onc next week.Â  Any INFO would be helpful. Dx 3/2008, DCIS, 1cm, Stage 0, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 9/2012, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 11/16/2012 AC + T (Taxol) Hormonal Therapy 3/15/2013 Femara (letrozole), Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Radiation Therapy 4/17/2013 3DCRT: Breast, Lymph nodes, Bone Targeted Therapy 11/26/2016 Ibrance (palbociclib) Log in to post a reply
